intro: Eucrypta chrysanthemifolia, commonly known as the golden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought resistance. The flowers bloom in late summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
